intro: Cakile lanceolata subsp. fusiformis, commonly known as the broadleaf sandmat, is a perennial flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops and weeds. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, broad leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its morphology and growth habits make it well adapted to harsh, nutrient-poor conditions.
